evidence: After blocking the exit with his troops, he ordered them to shoot at the crowd, continuing to fire even as the protestors tried to flee. The troops kept on firing until their ammunition was exhausted. [8] Estimates of those killed vary from 379 to 1,500 or more people [1] and over 1,200 other people were injured of whom 192 were seriously injured. [9] [10] Britain has never formally apologised for the massacre but expressed "deep regret" in 2019.

claim_target: On October 19, 2021, a landslide on NH-109 near Dhanaulti in Uttarakhand caused boulders and debris to fall on a vehicle, killing two people traveling in it.
query: What caused the deaths on NH-109 near Dhanaulti in Uttarakhand on October 19, 2021?
evidence: 34 Killed Amid Heavy Rains, Destruction In State India News Edited by Sasha Gopalakrishnan Updated: October 20, 2021 3:15 am IST Uttarakhand Floods: A car was swept away by the stream and precariously caught between two boulders. Dehradun: 34 people have been reported dead, including labourers from Nepal who were buried alive by rubble, and people from Champawat district where a house collapsed after a landslide.
